segments.en: And today we're at a party.
segments.cn: 今天我们在一个派对上。

segments.en: Yeah, this is a great, exciting, fun, energetic lesson.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一个伟大、激动人心、有趣、充满活力的课程。

segments.en: We're at the biggest party in the world.
segments.cn: 我们在世界上最大的派对上。

segments.en: This is the name of a city, right?
segments.cn: 这是一个城市的名字，对吗？

segments.en: Yeah, this is a city in Brazil called Rio de Janeiro.
segments.cn: 是的，这是巴西的一个城市，叫里约热内卢。

segments.en: Your sound is a lot more, I don't know, authentic than mine.
segments.cn: 你的发音听起来比我的更地道。

segments.en: So, we sometimes refer to it as Rio just to make it shorter.
segments.cn: 所以我们有时称它为里约，以便简短一些。

segments.en: Yeah, I think that's actually the most common way it's referred to in English.
segments.cn: 是的，我认为这实际上是英语中最常用的称呼。

segments.en: It's just like if you would say Los Angeles, you would say LA.
segments.cn: 就像你说洛杉矶时，会说LA。

segments.en: Yeah, or if you're talking about Kuala Lumpur, you might say KL.
segments.cn: 是的，或者如果你在谈论吉隆坡，你可能会说KL。

segments.en: Okay, so we have some words that we're going to preview before we listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有一些单词要在听对话之前预览。

segments.en: So let's start with vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 所以让我们开始词汇预览。

segments.en: Okay, in vocabulary preview, we have one word, sambadrome.
segments.cn: 好吧，在词汇预览中，我们有一个词，sambadrome。

segments.en: So it's a proper noun, not a common noun, right?
segments.cn: 所以这是一个专有名词，而不是普通名词，对吗？

segments.en: No, it's not really a common noun.
segments.cn: 不，这并不是真正的普通名词。

segments.en: It's a proper noun, but it is a building.
segments.cn: 这是一个专有名词，但它是一个建筑。

segments.en: And what happens in this building?
segments.cn: 那么这个建筑里发生了什么？

segments.en: Basically, it's very similar to a stadium, but each end isn't closed off.
segments.cn: 基本上，它非常类似于一个体育场，但两端并没有封闭。

segments.en: So you have stands on one side, and stands on the other, and you have like a little street in the middle.
segments.cn: 所以你一侧有看台，另一侧也有看台，中间有一条小街。

segments.en: So you can sit down and you can watch people parade or walk by, and you can see the dancers and everything.
segments.cn: 所以你可以坐下来观看人们游行或走过，你可以看到舞者和一切。

segments.en: And so what is it used for?
segments.cn: 那么它是用来做什么的？

segments.en: The sambadrome is used so that the samba schools can present their dances and their dancers and their costumes to judges and all the people that want to watch them dance samba.
segments.cn: Sambadrome是用来让桑巴学校向评委和所有想观看他们跳桑巴的人展示他们的舞蹈、舞者和服装。

segments.en: Okay, so you've been using this word a lot, samba.
segments.cn: 好吧，你一直在使用这个词，桑巴。

segments.en: Samba is a type of dance that Brazil is famous for.
segments.cn: 桑巴是一种巴西著名的舞蹈。

segments.en: It's a very fast dance, a lot of hip movements, a lot of... it's very fast, but it's very, very nice, and the music is based with many different type of tropical instruments, so it's really, really fun.
segments.cn: 这是一种非常快速的舞蹈，很多臀部动作，非常快，但非常好，音乐基于许多不同类型的热带乐器，所以真的很有趣。

segments.en: I can samba a little bit.
It's trickier than what it seems.
Okay, well, we're actually going to hear some samba music in the dialogue, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们实际上会在对话中听到一些桑巴音乐，对吧？

segments.en: We're going to hear some samba that is actually used during carnival.
segments.cn: 我们将听到一些在狂欢节期间使用的桑巴音乐。

segments.en: So, okay, so let's go to Rio now and listen to some samba.
segments.cn: 好吧，那我们现在去里约，听一些桑巴。
我简直不敢相信我们在这里！

segments.en: Seriously, this is like a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.
segments.cn: 说真的，这就像一次千载难逢的机会。

segments.en: We're here at the biggest party in the world.
segments.cn: 我们在世界上最大的派对上。

segments.en: We're so lucky we found tickets for the samba drum.
segments.cn: 我们真幸运，找到了桑巴鼓的票。

segments.en: Good thing we found that ticket, Scalper.
segments.cn: 幸好我们找到了那张票，黄牛。

segments.en: Look at how many dancers there are.
Oh my gosh, the costumes are so colorful.
segments.cn: 哦我的天，服装真是五彩缤纷。

segments.en: It says here that the school that is dancing now is one of the oldest and most prestigious samba schools in Rio.
segments.cn: 这里说正在跳舞的学校是里约最古老和最有声望的桑巴学校之一。

segments.en: Look at that girl on top of that float!
segments.cn: 看看那个在花车上的女孩！

segments.en: She must be the Carnival Queen!
Move over there, so I can get a picture of you.
segments.cn: 移到那边，我可以给你拍张照片。

segments.en: Really, I don't know how to dance.
Patrick, don't just leave me here!
segments.cn: Patrick，别就这样把我留在这里！
好吧，真是个幸运的家伙！

segments.en: He got asked out to dance by a beautiful Brazilian samba dancer.
segments.cn: 他被一个美丽的巴西桑巴舞者邀请跳舞。

segments.en: I don't think his wife was very happy, though.
segments.cn: 不过我觉得他的妻子并不太高兴。

segments.en: Well, we've got some language about Carnival in Rio, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有一些关于里约狂欢节的语言，对吧？

segments.en: So let's look at that now with Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 那么让我们现在看看语言要点。

segments.en: Alright, our first word on Language Takeaway today.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天语言要点的第一个词。

segments.en: This is actually a job title, I think.
segments.cn: 这实际上是一个职位名称，我认为。

segments.en: Maybe not a totally legal job title, but... Exactly.
segments.cn: 也许不是一个完全合法的职位名称，但... 正是如此。

segments.en: So what does a ticket scalper do?
Basically, this person will sell tickets at a higher price to people who don't have tickets.
segments.cn: 基本上，这个人会以更高的价格向没有票的人出售票。

segments.en: Okay, so he buys like 100 tickets.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以他买了大约100张票。

segments.en: And goes and stands outside of the samba drome or the stadium.
segments.cn: 然后站在桑巴大街或体育场外面。

segments.en: And he sells them for like twice the price.
segments.cn: 然后他以两倍的价格出售。

segments.en: Actually, they come in handy sometimes because you want to go to concert or something and you don't have tickets.
segments.cn: 其实，有时候它们很有用，因为你想去音乐会或其他活动，但没有票。

segments.en: You got to turn to them, right?
Now this is a very nice word, prestigious.
Before we explain anything, let's listen to some examples.
segments.cn: 在我们解释之前，先听一些例子。

segments.en: Harvard University is one of the most prestigious schools in North America.
segments.cn: 哈佛大学是北美最有声望的学校之一。

segments.en: The Academy Award is the most prestigious prize an actor can get in the film industry.
segments.cn: 奥斯卡奖是演员在电影行业中能获得的最有声望的奖项。

segments.en: He worked really hard and now he is a very prestigious heart surgeon.
segments.cn: 他努力工作，现在是一位非常有声望的心脏外科医生。

segments.en: I can see that when something is prestigious, it's really well respected, right?
segments.cn: 我可以看出，当某事很有声望时，它确实受到很高的尊重，对吧？
它是众所周知的，受到尊重。

segments.en: And if you are part of this thing, you can feel a sense of pride.
segments.cn: 如果你是这个事物的一部分，你会感到自豪。

segments.en: Okay, now let's take a look at our last word, float.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们来看最后一个单词，float。

segments.en: Now this doesn't mean like to float in water, right?
segments.cn: 这并不是指在水中漂浮，对吧？

segments.en: No, this is a noun, not a verb.
segments.cn: 不，这个是名词，不是动词。

segments.en: It's kind of hard to describe actually.
Yeah, it is hard to describe.
A float is something that you commonly see in parades.
segments.cn: float是你在游行中常见的东西。

segments.en: Right, so it'd be like a car, but you can't really see the car.
segments.cn: 对，所以它就像一辆车，但你看不到车。

segments.en: No, because it's covered with decoration.
segments.cn: 不，因为它被装饰覆盖了。

segments.en: But big decorations and it's made to look like an artificial island.
segments.cn: 但有大装饰，看起来像一个人造岛。

segments.en: So you have people standing on there and dancing or waving.
segments.cn: 所以你会看到人们站在上面跳舞或挥手。

segments.en: Okay, we'll definitely post a picture of a float on our comment section so you could see what a float looks like.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们一定会在评论区发布一张float的图片，这样你就可以看到float的样子。

segments.en: Okay, so now let's listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们再听一遍对话。

segments.en: We're going to slow it down a little bit so you can understand all of these words we've just talked about.
segments.cn: 我们会稍微放慢速度，这样你可以理解我们刚刚谈到的所有单词。

segments.en: Look at how many dancers there are.
Oh my gosh, the costumes are so colorful.
segments.cn: 哦，我的天，服装真五彩缤纷。

segments.en: It says here that the school that is dancing now is one of the oldest and most prestigious Samba schools in Rio.
segments.cn: 这里说现在跳舞的学校是里约最古老和最有声望的桑巴学校之一。

segments.en: Look at that girl on top of that float.
segments.cn: 看看那个在float上面的女孩。

segments.en: She must be the Carnival Queen.
Move over there so I can get a picture of you.
segments.cn: 过来那边，我可以给你拍张照片。

segments.en: I don't know how to dance.
Patrick, don't just leave me here.
segments.cn: 帕特里克，别就这样把我留在这里。

segments.en: So now I think we should take a look at some of the phrases.
segments.cn: 现在我想我们应该看看一些短语。

segments.en: So we have this phrase, once in a lifetime.
segments.cn: 我们有这个短语，一生一次。

segments.en: So this is an expression you would use to say that it doesn't happen very often.
segments.cn: 这是一个表达，表示它不常发生。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a really special event.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一个非常特别的事件。

segments.en: So like a once in a lifetime opportunity.
segments.cn: 所以像一生一次的机会。

segments.en: Or a once in a lifetime chance.
Let's look at our next phrase.
segments.cn: 让我们看看下一个短语。

segments.en: So we have some examples for good thing.
segments.cn: 我们有一些好事的例子。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to them and then we'll come back.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不听听，然后再回来。

segments.en: Good thing I studied for my exam.
It's a good thing I brought my umbrella.
It's a good thing that I bought my house before the prices went up.
segments.cn: 幸好我在房价上涨之前买了房子。

segments.en: Good thing I had money in my wallet.
You're happy you had money in your wallet.
segments.cn: 你很高兴你钱包里有钱。

segments.en: You could also maybe use it as a negative, right?
segments.cn: 你也可以把它用作负面，对吧？

segments.en: Like good thing I didn't go.
Right, I'm happy I didn't go because it was terrible.
segments.cn: 对，我很高兴我没去，因为那太糟糕了。

segments.en: Alright, now let's take a look at our last word.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在让我们看看最后一个单词。

segments.en: Okay, so many of you probably already know this word kidding, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，你们中的许多人可能已经知道这个单词“kidding”，对吧？
是的，它的意思是开玩笑。

segments.en: Okay, but if I would say no kidding.
You're saying like, yeah, I totally agree with you.
segments.cn: 你是在说，是的，我完全同意你。

segments.en: So I could say, wow, this restaurant is really expensive.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，哇，这家餐厅真的很贵。

segments.en: Yeah, so you would agree it's like, yeah, for real.
segments.cn: 是的，所以你会同意这就像，是的，真的。

segments.en: So this term no kidding is slang, right?
segments.cn: 所以这个术语“no kidding”是俚语，对吧？

segments.en: It's a little bit informal, yeah.
So why don't we listen to our dialogue again for the third time and then we'll come back and talk about Brazil.
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不再听一次对话，然后再回来谈谈巴西呢？
我真不敢相信我们在这里。

segments.en: This is like a once in a lifetime opportunity.
segments.cn: 这就像一次千载难逢的机会。

segments.en: We're here at the biggest party in the world.
segments.cn: 我们在世界上最大的派对上。

segments.en: We're so lucky we found tickets for the Sambadrome.
segments.cn: 我们真幸运，找到了桑巴广场的票。

segments.en: Good thing we found that ticket scalper.
segments.cn: 幸好我们找到了那个票贩子。

segments.en: Look at how many dancers there are.
Oh my gosh, the costumes are so colorful.
segments.cn: 哦，我的天，服装真五彩缤纷。

segments.en: It says here that the school that is dancing now is one of the oldest and most prestigious Samba schools in Rio.
segments.cn: 这里说现在跳舞的学校是里约最古老和最有声望的桑巴学校之一。

segments.en: Look at that girl on top of that float.
segments.cn: 看看那个在花车上的女孩。

segments.en: She must be the Carnival Queen.
Move over there so I can get a picture of you.
segments.cn: 站到那边去，我好给你拍张照片。

segments.en: I don't know how to dance.
Patrick, don't just leave me here.
segments.cn: 帕特里克，别就这样把我留在这里。
这是巴西的庆祝活动，对吧？

segments.en: It's very popular in all Latin America.
segments.cn: 在整个拉丁美洲都很受欢迎。

segments.en: Yeah, but Brazilian Carnival is very, very special.
segments.cn: 是的，但巴西的狂欢节非常特别。

segments.en: Okay, so what are they celebrating?
So basically it's the beginning of Lent, which is this period of time in the Catholic religion right before Easter.
segments.cn: 基本上是斋戒期的开始，这是天主教在复活节前的这段时间。

segments.en: But Carnival in Brazil is very special because of all the dancing and all of this and costumes and everything.
segments.cn: 但巴西的狂欢节非常特别，因为有很多舞蹈、服装和一切。

segments.en: Yeah, well, from the dialogue it sounds really wild and crazy.
segments.cn: 是的，从对话中听起来真的很疯狂。

segments.en: Well, it definitely is really amazing and it's just basically a lot of samba music and partying and it's really nice.
segments.cn: 嗯，确实非常惊人，基本上是很多桑巴音乐和派对，真的很不错。

segments.en: And especially to be able to see something so spectacular is like hundreds and thousands of dancers in the samba drum and they're parading down in their costumes and in floats.
segments.cn: 特别是能够看到如此壮观的场面，成百上千的舞者在桑巴鼓上游行，穿着他们的服装和花车。

segments.en: So it's a very, very special event.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常特别的活动。

segments.en: All right, so it sounds like a lot of fun.
I want to hear from our listeners.
segments.cn: 我想听听我们的听众的意见。

segments.en: We have a lot of listeners from Brazil and Carnival is not only celebrated in Rio.
segments.cn: 我们有很多来自巴西的听众，狂欢节不仅在里约庆祝。

segments.en: It's also in São Paulo, in Pernambuco, in Bahia, and it's a little bit different in each place.
segments.cn: 也在圣保罗、伯南布哥、巴伊亚，每个地方都有点不同。

segments.en: So it's not just a thing of Rio.
segments.cn: 所以这不仅仅是里约的事情。

segments.en: Is there a samba drum in each city?
segments.cn: 每个城市都有桑巴鼓吗？

segments.en: Yeah, there is a samba drum in São Paulo.
Let us know if you've ever been to Carnival or how you celebrated in your hometown or in your city.
segments.cn: 如果你曾经去过狂欢节，或者在你家乡或城市是如何庆祝的，请告诉我们。

segments.en: Yeah, come to our website, EnglishPod.com and leave us your comments all about Carnival.
segments.cn: 是的，来我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，给我们留言，分享你关于狂欢节的评论。

segments.en: And everyone be sure to come because we're going to post some videos of what samba is like and some photos so you can get an idea of this really interesting Brazilian celebration.
segments.cn: 大家一定要来，因为我们将发布一些关于桑巴的视频和照片，让你了解这个非常有趣的巴西庆祝活动。
